texts.text: My school is called ABC Public School.It is located in a big city and has a beautiful campus. My school has a large building with many classrooms, labs, library, auditorium, playground, etc. My school has well-qualified and experienced teachers who teach us various subjects such as English, Hindi, Maths, Science, Social Studies, etc. My school also offers many co-curricular and extra-curricular activities such as sports, music, dance, art, drama, debate, etc. My school has a friendly and disciplined environment where students learn and grow. I love my school and I am proud to be a part of it.

The room in which I found myself was very large and lofty. The windows were long, narrow, and pointed, and at so vast a distance from the black oaken floor as to be altogether inaccessible from within. The walls were painted with dark colors and adorned with portraits of stern-looking ancestors. The furniture was old-fashioned and heavy, with carved legs and clawed feet. The fireplace was huge and cold, with no sign of fire or warmth. The only light came from a single candle on a table near the door. The room was silent and gloomy, and I felt a chill run down my spine.

My mother is the most important person in my life. She is my best friend and my role model. She is very kind, loving, caring, and supportive. She always helps me with my homework and guides me in my studies. She also cooks delicious food for me and takes care of my health. She works hard at home and outside to provide for our family. She also teaches me good values and manners. She encourages me to follow my dreams and supports me in everything I do. She is the best mother in the world and I love her very much.

My dream job is to be a software engineer. I have always been fascinated by computers and how they work. I enjoy coding, debugging, and creating new applications. I also like to learn new technologies and languages that can enhance my skills and knowledge. I think software engineering is a creative and challenging profession that can make a positive impact on the world. I hope to work for a reputable company that values innovation, quality, and teamwork.

Reading is one of the best habits that one can develop. Reading has many benefits for the mind and the body. Reading can improve one's vocabulary, grammar, spelling, and writing skills. Reading can also enhance one's critical thinking, analytical, and problem-solving abilities. Reading can broaden one's horizons, expose one to different cultures, perspectives, and ideas. Reading can also stimulate one's imagination, creativity, and curiosity. Reading can also provide entertainment, relaxation, and pleasure. Reading is a valuable and rewarding activity that everyone should enjoy.

Friendship is one of the most important relationships in life. Friendship is based on mutual trust, respect, and affection. Friendship can provide support, comfort, and happiness to one's life. Friendship can also help one to overcome difficulties, challenges, and hardships. Friendship can also enrich one's personality, character, and values. Friendship can also inspire one to grow, learn, and achieve one's goals. Friendship is a precious and priceless gift that should be cherished and nurtured.

Dogs are truly remarkable creatures. They have been our loyal companions for thousands of years, offering unwavering love and companionship. Whether they are small or large, purebred or mixed breed, dogs have a special place in our hearts. They bring joy and happiness to our lives with their wagging tails, playful antics, and unconditional love. From being our exercise buddies to providing emotional support, dogs enrich our lives in countless ways. They are smart, intuitive, and capable of forming deep bonds with their human counterparts.

Dogs are one of the most beloved and popular pets around the world. They are known for their loyalty, affection, and playful nature. Dogs come in a wide variety of breeds, each with its own unique characteristics and traits. From small lap dogs to large working breeds, there is a dog out there for every lifestyle and preference. Dogs are not only great companions but also provide numerous benefits to their owners. They can help reduce stress, encourage physical activity, and even assist individuals with disabilities as service dogs.

Trees are one of the most important and prominent parts of the natural environment. They are not only aesthetically pleasing, but they also provide numerous benefits for the environment and for us. Trees help to reduce air pollution, improve air quality, and provide a habitat for wildlife. Trees also provide shade and reduce the amount of energy used for cooling homes and businesses. Trees help to reduce the amount of stormwater runoff, reduce soil erosion, and help to reduce the impacts of flooding. Trees also provide food and shelter for wildlife, help to purify the air, and provide us with oxygen. Trees help to conserve energy by providing shade and blocking wind.

Dogs are loyal, loving, and truly man's best friend. As pets, they bring joy, companionship, and endless entertainment to our lives. Whether it's a playful game of fetch or a cuddle session on the couch, dogs have an uncanny ability to make us feel loved and cherished. Beyond their role as beloved family members, dogs also serve important roles in society as service animals, therapy dogs, and working dogs. From guiding the blind to providing emotional support to those in need, dogs have proven time and time again that they are not just pets but valuable partners who enhance our lives in countless ways.

My favorite season is autumn. I like autumn because it is not too hot or too cold. I also like the colors of the leaves when they change from green to red, yellow, orange, and brown. Autumn is a good time to enjoy nature and do outdoor activities. I like to go hiking, biking, or camping with my friends and family. Autumn is also a time for celebrating festivals such as Halloween and Thanksgiving. I enjoy dressing up in costumes, carving pumpkins, and eating turkey with cranberry sauce.

Atoms of radioactive elements can split. According to Albert Einstein, mass and energy are interchangeable under certain circumstances. When atoms split, the process is called nuclear fission. In this case, a small amount of mass is converted into energy. Thus the energy released cannot do much damage. However, several subatomic particles called neutrons are also emitted during this process. Each neutron will hit a radioactive element releasing more neutrons in the process. This causes a chain reaction and creates a large amount of energy. This energy is converted into heat which expands uncontrollably causing an explosion.

Everyone knows that paper is made from trees. But when one looks at trees, one cannot imagine that something so soft and fragile as the paper is made is so hard and strong. Plant materials such as wood are made of fibres known as cellulose. It is the primary ingredient in paper making. Raw wood is first converted into pulp consisting of a mixture of Cellulose, lignin, water and some chemicals. The pulp can be made mechanically through grinders or through chemical processes. Short fibres are produced by mechanical grinding.

Gardening is my favourite hobby. I own a small plot of land next to our house. I cultivate gardening there. Every day, I spend half an hour gardening. After returning from my morning walk, I go to my garden with a spade and a bucket of water. I prepare the soil, prune the plants, and water them.

Christmas is one of the most popular festivals in the world. It is celebrated on December 25th every year to commemorate the birth of Jesus Christ, the founder of Christianity. Christmas is a time of joy, peace, and love. People decorate their homes with lights, candles, stars, bells, and wreaths. They also put up Christmas trees and hang stockings for Santa Claus to fill with gifts. On Christmas Eve, people go to church for midnight mass and sing carols.
